DataElement.preferredName: Lesion Alteration Satellite Neoplasm Absent Present Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication as to whether a satellite lesion is absent or present.  A satellite lesion is defined by one or more areas of enhancement within the region of signal abnormality surrounding the dominant lesion but not contiguous in any part with the major tumor mass

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: (LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change._A change resulting in something that is different from the original._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.:A change resulting in something that is different from the original.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
The act or process of modifying something.

Property.preferredDefinition: Situated near; accompanying.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/21/13 jc  DEC released post review against 1/14/2011 VASARI 3.0 Key.  6/22/09 used by VASARI F24 feature item

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator of being absent or present.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.

Concepts.definition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: Not existing in a specified place at a specified time.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
